instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message:
already tried a known good speaker and i get no sound from it. no chime.

j6703 does get voltages under 1v each pin gets. but on a known good board those pins get no voltage at all

tried swapping out <CHIP>U6620</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6610</CHIP> no luck. machine produces sound from the small speaker but not sub

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message:
Machine works, only missing sound from sub speaker?
PRAM reset done?
L6620/21 OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message: l6620/21 start at 2.5ohm and drop pram has been done multiple times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message:
Sub and right speakers share the same connector.
You must get similar DC voltage on both.
Did you try another speaker?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message: Yes tried another and even tried a known good board and it gives out a chime

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message:
Maybe <CHIP>U6620</CHIP> is not properly soldered.
You can also change <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>...

Check traces between the two chips.
Also <CAPACITOR>C6620</CAPACITOR>/21 and <RESISTOR>R6622</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message: Switched out <CHIP>U6620</CHIP> changed <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> checked traces for <CAPACITOR>C6620</CAPACITOR>/21 and <RESISTOR>R6622</RESISTOR> even changed out <CAPACITOR>C6620</CAPACITOR>/21. Still no luck but i did notice that <CHIP>U6880</CHIP> and sorrounding resistors had water damage as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6880</CHIP> is for microphone.
I suppose you still have some resistors, or small coils affected by corrosion in that area.
Various components related with tip detection can trick the audio codec.
Also corroded trace could be...
Peel out the black sponge near BIL connector and clean the board there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime speaker sub not working
threads.message: Ran board through ultra sonic and replaced some suspicious resistors and retraced line but still no luck. Any other ideas?
